text:
Community colleges in California have a rather simple application for eligible first-time college students via the [College Promise Grant](https://www.cccapply.org/en/money/california-college-promise-grant). California residents who recently graduated high school can qualify for up to two years of waived enrollment fees. Whether you want to transfer, dive into a CTE program, or want a certificate, the CCC system has amazing opportunities and the affordability of it all is hard to argue. 

Many even have Bachelorâ€™s programs integrated in their campuses (I.e. Point Loma Nazarene University is a private Christian university in SoCal and it has multiple BA programs at [Grossmont](https://www.pointloma.edu/locations/grossmont-college) and [Cuyamaca](https://www.pointloma.edu/locations/cuyamaca-college) Community Colleges as well [Southwestern College](https://www.swccd.edu/programs-and-academics/specialty-programs/plnu-4-year-degree-program.aspx) )
